verses.hebrew: בְּרֵאשִׁית בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
verses.notes: The opening verse of the Hebrew Bible. Contains the key verb bara (create).

verses.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים יְהִי אֹור וַיְהִי־אֹור׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.

verses.hebrew: וַיִּבְרָא אֱלֹהִים ׀ אֶת־הָאָדָם בְּצַלְמֹו בְּצֶלֶם אֱלֹהִים בָּרָא אֹתֹו זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה בָּרָא אֹתָם׃
verses.referenceTranslation: So God created man in his [own] image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
verses.notes: Imago Dei - humanity created in God's image.

verses.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל־אַבְרָם לֶךְ־לְךָ מֵאַרְצְךָ וּמִמֹּולַדְתְּךָ וּמִבֵּית אָבִיךָ אֶל־הָאָרֶץ אֲשֶׁר אַרְאֶךָּ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ Now the LORD had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father's house, unto a land that I will shew thee:
verses.notes: The call of Abram. Imperative verb lekh-lekha.

verses.hebrew: וְהֶאֱמִן בַּיהוָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לֹּו צְדָקָה׃
verses.referenceTranslation: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.
verses.notes: Key verse on faith and righteousness.

verses.hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא אַבְרָהָם שֵׁם־הַמָּקֹום הַהוּא יְהוָה ׀ יִרְאֶה אֲשֶׁר יֵאָמֵר הַיֹּום בְּהַר יְהוָה יֵרָאֶה׃
verses.referenceTranslation: And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovahjireh: as it is said [to] this day, In the mount of the LORD it shall be seen.
verses.notes: Yahweh Yireh - The LORD will provide.

verses.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים אֶל־מֹשֶׁה אֶהְיֶה אֲשֶׁר אֶהְיֶה וַיֹּאמֶר כֹּה תֹאמַר לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶהְיֶה שְׁלָחַנִי אֲלֵיכֶם׃
verses.referenceTranslation: And God said unto Moses, I AM THAT I AM: and he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, I AM hath sent me unto you.
verses.notes: The divine name revealed. Ehyeh Asher Ehyeh.

verses.hebrew: אָנֹכִי יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֲשֶׁר הֹוצֵאתִיךָ מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם מִבֵּית עֲבָדִים׃
verses.referenceTranslation: I [am] the LORD thy God, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

verses.hebrew: לֹא יִהְיֶה־לְךָ  אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים עַל־פָּנָיַ ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.

verses.hebrew: לֹא־תִקֹּם וְלֹא־תִטֹּר אֶת־בְּנֵי עַמֶּךָ וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמֹוךָ אֲנִי יְהוָה׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I [am] the LORD.

verses.hebrew: שְׁמַע  יִשְׂרָאֵל יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ יְהוָה ׀ אֶחָד ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God [is] one LORD:
verses.notes: The Shema - central confession of Judaism.

verses.hebrew: וְאָהַבְתָּ אֵת יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ בְּכָל־לְבָבְךָ וּבְכָל־נַפְשְׁךָ וּבְכָל־מְאֹדֶךָ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: And thou shalt love the LORD thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.

verses.hebrew: הֲלֹוא צִוִּיתִיךָ חֲזַק וֶאֱמָץ אַל־תַּעֲרֹץ וְאַל־תֵּחָת כִּי עִמְּךָ יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר תֵּלֵךְ׃  פ
verses.referenceTranslation: Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the LORD thy God [is] with thee whithersoever thou goest.

verses.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי־הָאִישׁ  אֲשֶׁר ׀ לֹא הָלַךְ בַּעֲצַת רְשָׁעִים וּבְדֶרֶךְ חַטָּאִים לֹא עָמָד וּבְמֹושַׁב לֵצִים לֹא יָשָׁב׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ Blessed [is] the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.
verses.notes: Opening of the Psalter. Ashrei ha-ish.

verses.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ מִזְמֹור לְדָוִד׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

verses.hebrew: מִזְמֹור לְדָוִד יְהוָה רֹעִי לֹא אֶחְסָר׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ A Psalm of David. The LORD [is] my shepherd; I shall not want.

verses.hebrew: גַּם כִּי־אֵלֵךְ בְּגֵיא צַלְמָוֶת לֹא־אִירָא רָע כִּי־אַתָּה עִמָּדִי שִׁבְטְךָ וּמִשְׁעַנְתֶּךָ הֵמָּה יְנַחֲמֻנִי׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou [art] with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
verses.notes: Comfort in the face of death.

verses.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ לִבְנֵי־קֹרַח עַל־עֲלָמֹות שִׁיר׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, A Song upon Alamoth. God [is] our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

verses.hebrew: תַּשְׁמִיעֵנִי שָׂשֹׂון וְשִׂמְחָה תָּגֵלְנָה עֲצָמֹות דִּכִּיתָ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.hebrew: דְּעוּ כִּי־יְהוָה הוּא אֱלֹהִים הוּא־עָשָׂנוּ [וְלֹא כ] (וְלֹו ק) אֲנַחְנוּ עַמֹּו וְצֹאן מַרְעִיתֹו׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Know ye that the LORD he [is] God: [it is] he [that] hath made us, and not we ourselves; [we are] his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

verses.hebrew: נֵר־לְרַגְלִי דְבָרֶךָ וְאֹור לִנְתִיבָתִי׃
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ NUN. Thy word [is] a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

verses.hebrew: אֹודְךָ עַל כִּי נֹורָאֹות נִפְלֵיתִי נִפְלָאִים מַעֲשֶׂיךָ וְנַפְשִׁי יֹדַעַת מְאֹד׃
verses.referenceTranslation: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully [and] wonderfully made: marvellous [are] thy works; and [that] my soul knoweth right well.

verses.hebrew: יִרְאַת יְהוָה רֵאשִׁית דָּעַת חָכְמָה וּמוּסָר אֱוִילִים בָּזוּ׃  פ
verses.referenceTranslation: ¶ The fear of the LORD [is] the beginning of knowledge: [but] fools despise wisdom and instruction.

verses.hebrew: בְּטַח אֶל־יְהוָה בְּכָל־לִבֶּךָ וְאֶל־בִּינָתְךָ אַל־תִּשָּׁעֵן׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

verses.hebrew: בְּכָל־דְּרָכֶיךָ דָעֵהוּ וְהוּא יְיַשֵּׁר אֹרְחֹתֶיךָ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.notes: Acknowledge Him in all your ways.

verses.hebrew: וְקָרָא זֶה אֶל־זֶה וְאָמַר קָדֹושׁ ׀ קָדֹושׁ קָדֹושׁ יְהוָה צְבָאֹות מְלֹא כָל־הָאָרֶץ כְּבֹודֹו׃
verses.referenceTranslation: And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, [is] the LORD of hosts: the whole earth [is] full of his glory.

verses.hebrew: לָכֵן יִתֵּן אֲדֹנָי הוּא לָכֶם אֹות הִנֵּה הָעַלְמָה הָרָה וְיֹלֶדֶת בֵּן וְקָרָאת שְׁמֹו עִמָּנוּ אֵל׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Therefore the Lord himself shall give you a sign; Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

verses.hebrew: [לְמַרְבֵּה כ] (לְמַרְבֵּה  ק) הַמִּשְׂרָה וּלְשָׁלֹום אֵין־קֵץ עַל־כִּסֵּא דָוִד וְעַל־מַמְלַכְתֹּו לְהָכִין אֹתָהּ וּלְסַעֲדָהּ בְּמִשְׁפָּט וּבִצְדָקָה מֵעַתָּה וְעַד־עֹולָם קִנְאַת יְהוָה צְבָאֹות תַּעֲשֶׂה־זֹּאת׃    ס
verses.referenceTranslation: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given: and the government shall be upon his shoulder: and his name shall be called Wonderful, Counsellor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.
verses.notes: Messianic prophecy - names of the child.

verses.hebrew: וְקֹויֵ יְהוָה יַחֲלִיפוּ כֹחַ יַעֲלוּ אֵבֶר כַּנְּשָׁרִים יָרוּצוּ וְלֹא יִיגָעוּ יֵלְכוּ וְלֹא יִיעָפוּ׃  פ
verses.referenceTranslation: But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew [their] strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; [and] they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.notes: Those who wait on the LORD.

verses.hebrew: וְהוּא מְחֹלָל מִפְּשָׁעֵנוּ מְדֻכָּא מֵעֲוֹנֹתֵינוּ מוּסַר שְׁלֹומֵנוּ עָלָיו וּבַחֲבֻרָתֹו נִרְפָּא־לָנוּ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: But he [was] wounded for our transgressions, [he was] bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace [was] upon him; and with his stripes we are healed.

verses.hebrew: כֻּלָּנוּ כַּצֹּאן תָּעִינוּ אִישׁ לְדַרְכֹּו פָּנִינוּ וַיהוָה הִפְגִּיעַ בֹּו אֵת עֲוֹן כֻּלָּנוּ׃
verses.referenceTranslation: All we like sheep have gone astray; we have turned every one to his own way; and the LORD hath laid on him the iniquity of us all.

verses.hebrew: כִּי לֹא מַחְשְׁבֹותַי מַחְשְׁבֹותֵיכֶם וְלֹא דַרְכֵיכֶם דְּרָכָי נְאֻם יְהוָה׃
verses.referenceTranslation: For my thoughts [are] not your thoughts, neither [are] your ways my ways, saith the LORD.

verses.hebrew: כִּי אָנֹכִי יָדַעְתִּי אֶת־הַמַּחֲשָׁבֹת אֲשֶׁר אָנֹכִי חֹשֵׁב עֲלֵיכֶם נְאֻם־יְהוָה מַחְשְׁבֹות שָׁלֹום וְלֹא לְרָעָה לָתֵת לָכֶם אַחֲרִית וְתִקְוָה׃
verses.referenceTranslation: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the LORD, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
verses.notes: Plans for hope and a future.

verses.hebrew: כִּי זֹאת הַבְּרִית אֲשֶׁר אֶכְרֹת אֶת־בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֲרֵי הַיָּמִים הָהֵם נְאֻם־יְהוָה נָתַתִּי אֶת־תֹּורָתִי בְּקִרְבָּם וְעַל־לִבָּם אֶכְתֲּבֶנָּה וְהָיִיתִי לָהֶם לֵאלֹהִים וְהֵמָּה יִהְיוּ־לִי לְעָם׃
verses.referenceTranslation: But this [shall be] the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel; After those days, saith the LORD, I will put my law in their inward parts, and write it in their hearts; and will be their God, and they shall be my people.

verses.hebrew: הֵן אִיתַי אֱלָהַנָא דִּי־אֲנַחְנָא פָלְחִין יָכִל לְשֵׁיזָבוּתַנָא מִן־אַתּוּן נוּרָא יָקִדְתָּא וּמִן־יְדָךְ מַלְכָּא יְשֵׁיזִב׃
verses.referenceTranslation: If it be [so], our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and he will deliver [us] out of thine hand, O king.

verses.hebrew: הִגִּיד לְךָ אָדָם מַה־טֹּוב וּמָה־יְהוָה דֹּורֵשׁ מִמְּךָ כִּי אִם־עֲשֹׂות מִשְׁפָּט וְאַהֲבַת חֶסֶד וְהַצְנֵעַ לֶכֶת עִם־אֱלֹהֶיךָ׃  פ
verses.referenceTranslation: He hath shewed thee, O man, what [is] good; and what doth the LORD require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?

verses.hebrew: הִנֵּה עֻפְּלָה לֹא־יָשְׁרָה נַפְשֹׁו בֹּו וְצַדִּיק בֶּאֱמוּנָתֹו יִחְיֶה׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Behold, his soul [which] is lifted up is not upright in him: but the just shall live by his faith.
verses.notes: The righteous shall live by faith.

verses.hebrew: הָבִיאוּ אֶת־כָּל־הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אֶל־בֵּית הָאֹוצָר וִיהִי טֶרֶף בְּבֵיתִי וּבְחָנוּנִי נָא בָּזֹאת אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאֹות אִם־לֹא אֶפְתַּח לָכֶם אֵת אֲרֻבֹּות הַשָּׁמַיִם וַהֲרִיקֹתִי לָכֶם בְּרָכָה עַד־בְּלִי־דָי׃
verses.referenceTranslation: Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse, that there may be meat in mine house, and prove me now herewith, saith the LORD of hosts, if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that [there shall] not [be room] enough [to receive it].
